Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Tapioca \Tap`i*o"ca\, n. [Braz. tapioka: cf. Pg., Sp. & F. tapioca.] A coarsely granular substance obtained by heating, and thus partly changing, the moistened starch obtained from the roots of the cassava. It is much used in puddings and as a thickening for soups. See {Cassava}. [1913 Webster]
tapioca n : granular preparation of cassava starch used to thicken especially puddings
